translation_en_to_zh.source: The answer has nothing to do with their cause , however , but with the simple fact that dictionaries are mot exercises in bi - unique substitutability ; in other words , if one of the senses of run is ` operate ' ( as in She runs an engine factory ), that does mot make it valid to assume that one can substitute operate for run in We run in the marathon every year. Although recognizing this as a shortcoming of dictionaries and assigning it arbitrarily to what , for lack of a better term , we might call the genius of the language , might seem trivial to the casual observer , it is a valid matter for concern in the realm of lexicology.
translation_en_to_zh.target: 然而，答案与他们的原因无关，而是与简单的事实有关，即字典不是双重独特可替代性练习;换句话说，如果run的一个意思是“运行”（例如，她运行一个发动机工厂），这并不意味着可以假定可以用operate替换run在我们每年在马拉松中跑。虽然认识到这是字典的一个缺点，并将其任意地分配给我们可能称之为语言天才的东西，对于随便的观察者来说，这似乎微不足道，但这是词汇学领域值得关注的一个有效问题。
